title: Buckingham Palace Offers A Whopping £30,000-A-Year Just To Manage The Queen's Twitter Account - Indiatimes.com
text:
February 13, 2017 
Schools don't teach you a thing; or at least the things they ought to! 
They don't teach you how to pay taxes, they don't teach you about the ' biki hui gormint ' and they don't even teach how to search for good jobs. 
But what hurts the most is that they didn't teach how to manage a twitter account, because someone can be making £30,000 a year by just doing that. Buckingham Palace wanted me to run the Queen's Twitter account for 30,000 pounds a year. Typical low budget by clients, naturally I said no — Cyril D (@CyrilDabs) February 12, 2017 
homesandproperty Yes, Buckingham Palace is offering a 30,000 pounds annual package for a job to run Queen Elizabeth's personal Twitter account, having 2.77 million followers. 
The Queen's official website has recently put across an advertisement, stating that they are looking for a 'Digital Communication Officer' to join a "fast-paced" and "dynamic" team. 
This will be a full-time opportunity and the individual will be asked to manage her account by letting the world know about her work and the Royal Family's public role. 
thedailybeast 
Not just Twitter, the person in charge will be managing her Facebook and YouTube too. They will be asked to document state visits, award ceremonies and Royal engagements. 
And if you are thinking that's about it, then wait till you hear about the perks. 
(Also read: 12 Privileges The Queen Of England Enjoys While You Just Sit There Living Your Life ) 
wikimedia Apart from what one would make, they'd be given 15 per cent employer contribution pension scheme along with special training and "personal development". 
"It's knowing your content will be viewed by millions. It's finding new ways to maintain The Queen's presence in the public eye and on the world stage" the post on the official website reads. 
"This is what makes working for the Royal Household exceptional," it said. 
(Also read: Duchess Kate Shines at Queen's Party ) 
metro 
Well, it sure does. But hey, if you think this is just another job, then think twice. It goes without saying that the person needs to be extremely good at this - no room for error and remarkably impeccable. Don't Miss
